Her research projects share the common theme of reducing or eliminating waste in systems software, to better support applications including graph, database, and LLM processing. Email Share Prior to joining MBZUAI, Professor Ma worked as a principal scientist at Qatar Computing Research Institute, and as an associate professor at North Carolina State University. She has produced 100 publications and served as associate editor for ACM ToS and Elsevier JPDC, as well as PC co-chair for conferences such as USENIX FAST 2024. In addition, she has served as PC member for numerous conferences, including OSDI, ASPLOS, FAST, EuroSys, Supercomputing, USENIX ATC, ICS, and HPDC. Ph.D. in Computer Science, University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign, 2003. ACM Distinguished Member, 2020. ACM Gordon Bell Award Finalist, Supercomputing Conference, 2018. Best Paper Finalist, Supercomputing Conference, 2014, 2006. Invitee (among 30 outstanding US engineers aged 30-45 selected by the National Academy of Engineering), 2014 Indo-American Frontiers of Engineering Symposium (IAFOE). Distinguished Alumni Educator Award, Department of Computer Science, University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign, 2012. NetApp Faculty Fellowship, 2012. HPDC 20 Years Best Papers Award (among 22 papers selected from 1992-2012), 2012. IBM Faculty Award, 2009. NSF CAREER Award, 2006. DOE Early Career Principal Investigator Award, 2005.
